collection-1.id: You can write any id you like as long as it is unique in the collection.
collection-1.title: Collection 1 first

collection-1.id: Creating resources trough the REST API will use an uuid v4 by default.
collection-1.title: Collection 1 second

collection-1.id: You can move to collection-2 to learn more about this app.
collection-1.title: Collection 1 fourth

collection-2.id: You can have multiple collections in a dataset.
collection-2.title: Collection 2 first

collection-2.id: A collection correspond to a model but is not strongly typed yet, check the doc to know how to do it manually.
collection-2.title: Collection 2 second

collection-2.id: You can type your collections by updating zod validators in the project.
collection-2.title: Collection 2 third

collection-2.id: Now you can change which dataset is active in the dataset view, use tutorial-dataset-2 and come back on the collections screen.
collection-2.title: Collection 2 fourth

collection-1.id: You can set multiple datasets with any kind of collections you like, The REST API and collection page will use this one only.
collection-1.title: Collection 1 first

collection-2.id: You'll be able to test each dataset separately on your apps as well.
collection-2.title: Collection 2 first

collection-2.id: Two datasets with the same models correspond to different use cases of one app.
collection-2.title: Collection 2 second

collection-2.id: Two datasets with different models can be used if you are testing different apps or a data driven one
collection-2.title: Collection 2 third
collection-2.something-different: The database supports it as long as you don't prevent it in the zod validator.

collection-2.id: Everything in this app can be update in the databa, we don't always provide specific UI to manage the app so feel free to explore !
collection-2.title: Collection 2 fourth

rename-me-in-database-view.id: You can indeed rename anything you want in your datasets.
rename-me-in-database-view.title: Example 1

hidden-dataset.hidden: Optional: You can set this property to hide a dataset in the UI and use this value to explain why. (only in database editor)

application-settings.description: Application settings are required by the app, do not delete or rename, but feel free to update the values.
application-settings.hidden: Required here: The application settings are not a valid dataset and cannot be processed by the current REST API.

active-dataset.description: Which dataset to use in previews and by the REST API.

saved-previews.name: This app on port 5173
saved-previews.description: Preview the app currently running (or else on port 5173).

saved-previews.name: Reroute API of a local app on port 5174 to this app's REST API
saved-previews.description: Try to run two instances of this app and see how the wrong request to /api is rerouted to /api/REST on your current app.

saved-previews.name: Edit this list in database editor
saved-previews.description: It can be handy if you are often testing the same app

saved-previews.name: You can even configure the rerouting logic in the editor
saved-previews.description: It can be handy if an app you are testing has endpoints requiring specific rules.
